root.title: Arjan II (е-103)
root.names: Е 103, Bronze metal plate from barrow «Аржан II»
root.place: The ruin of round stone construction has been dug out beside a Scythian barrow in settlement Arzhan on coast of the river Uyk. There have been found a horn bit (е-102) and a metal plate (е-103) with Turkic inscriptions.
root.store: Subjects are in the State Hermitage for time storage among findings of Krasnoyarsk expedition; ЛО ИА АН СССР.
root.description: The inscription on the bronze metal plate consists of 2 signs. There are traces of almost removed traces of more signs beside.
root.size: Height of signs about 1.5 cm, length of text nearby 4 cm
root.details: Васильев Д. Д. Корпус тюркских рунических памятников бассейна Енисея.

pdf.f_title: Памятники тюркской рунической письменности азиатского ареала.
